text: A [CURIE](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CURIE) defines a generic abbreviated syntax for expressing Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs). e.g. [company:012345], [public-body:cabinet-office]. Relative values link to the register identified in the entry for the field in the field register.
A [URL](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_locator) reference to another resource on the Web.

A combination of a date and a time in the format `CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z]` as described in chapter 5.4 of [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601). The value can be truncated to just the most significant digits, for example "2014-05". Time values, where present, should be in UTC.

A time interval as described in [ISO 8601](http://https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601). The intervening time between two points can be described in four ways: start date and end date, start date and duration, duration and end date or duration only. A start date and end date must follow the [datetime datatype](https://datatype.cloudapps.digital/record/datetime) and a duration must be formatted as described by ISO 8601.
A string of [Unicode 6.2.x](http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.2.0/) characters encoded as [UTF-8](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8).
A string of text which may contain [Markdown](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown) formatting instructions.
A longitude value which should be 6 or fewer decimal places, using the WGS84 or ETRS89 coordinate system.
A latitude value which should be 6 or fewer decimal places, using the WGS84 or ETRS89 coordinate system.
A decimal value compatible with XML Schema xs:decimal type.
An integer value compatible with XML Schema xs:integer type.
